meanings.definition: A solid figure with parallel ends and all other faces parallelograms.
meanings.sent1: The prismatoid on the table had a rectangular base and slanted sides.
meanings.sent2: The architect designed a prismatoid building with a triangular top and a square base.
meanings.sent3: The prismatoid rolled off the shelf and landed on its side, looking like a tilted box.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a prismatoid of thoughts, each side representing a different idea.
meanings.sent5: The prismatoid shape of the crystal made it refract light in beautiful patterns.

meanings.definition: A geometric figure with parallel sides and a polygonal base.
meanings.sent1: The prismatoid in the math book had a hexagonal base and straight sides.
meanings.sent2: The jewelry box was a prismatoid, with a square base and four rectangular sides.
meanings.sent3: The prismatoid cookie cutter made cookies in the shape of parallelograms.
meanings.sent4: His yard was a prismatoid of different flower beds, each with a unique polygonal shape.
meanings.sent5: The prismatoid pattern on the rug added a modern touch to the room.

meanings.definition: A three-dimensional figure with parallel polygonal bases and lateral faces that are parallelograms.
meanings.sent1: The prismatoid model in the classroom had a triangular base and slanted sides.
meanings.sent2: The prismatoid tent was easy to set up, with its rectangular base and sloping sides.
meanings.sent3: The prismatoid cake looked like a delicious stack of parallelogram layers.
meanings.sent4: Her bookshelf was a prismatoid of books, neatly arranged in parallel rows.
meanings.sent5: The prismatoid structure of the building made it stand out among the rest.
